stories.title: The Legend of the Electric Eel
stories.content: Our underwater guide discovered an ancient electric eel that had evolved beyond normal parameters. This magnificent creature could generate enough electricity to stun even the largest predators. The key to unlocking this evolution path? Consuming bioluminescent plankton in the deep trenches for 100 consecutive days.

stories.title: Survival Tips: The Art of Camouflage
stories.content: Master the art of camouflage by studying your environment. In coral reefs, evolve patterns that match the coral colors. In sandy areas, develop lighter scales. The best camouflage isn't just visual - it's behavioral. Stay still when predators are near, and move only when necessary.

stories.title: The Great Migration Mystery
stories.content: Every year, massive schools of fish migrate across the ocean, following ancient routes that have existed for millennia. In our game, these migration events offer unique opportunities for massive feeding frenzies. But beware - where there are schools of prey, there are also schools of predators!

stories.title: Evolution Strategy: Speed vs. Size
stories.content: One of the biggest decisions in Fish Love is whether to prioritize speed or size. Speed allows you to escape predators and catch fast prey, while size gives you access to larger prey and better defense. The secret? Balance both, but specialize based on your preferred hunting style.

stories.title: The Hidden Depths: Bioluminescent Secrets
stories.content: Deep in the abyss, where sunlight never reaches, bioluminescent creatures create their own light. These areas are perfect for stealth hunting, as you can use the ambient light to see without being seen. Some players have discovered that certain bioluminescent prey grant temporary night vision abilities.

stories.title: Community Spotlight: The Reef Builders
stories.content: Meet the players who have dedicated themselves to protecting and expanding the coral reefs. These 'Reef Builders' have discovered that maintaining healthy coral ecosystems attracts more diverse prey and creates natural barriers against large predators. Their efforts have created some of the most beautiful and profitable hunting grounds in the game.
